0b851f73-e399-4e4e-8280-e1cd8c469084:
A character can study an opponent he can see as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. The character then gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against it. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of character class abilities against that opponent increase by 1.
If a character deals sneak attack damage to a target, he studies that target, allowing him to apply his studied target bonuses against that target (including to the normal weapon damage roll).
At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the bonuses on weapon attack rolls, damage rolls and to character save DCs against a studied target increase by 1.
At 7th level, a character can study an opponent as a move or {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
ee1cc170-0e4e-4f13-8276-077f21b704be: A slayer can use the {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} to hide in any of his favored terrains, even if the terrain doesn't grant cover or {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}.
2bac4ea6-a23a-494d-974f-0f499e8972c4: A slayer is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, as well as with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
347e8ea0-50ea-4753-9c57-fe193db08660:
A spawn slayer specializes in fighting against larger, single targets. At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against a studied target increase by 1, as do the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of slayer abilities against a studied target. At 5th level, if the target is Large or larger, these bonuses increase by an additional 1. At 10th level, if the target is Huge or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 2. At 15th level, if the target is Gargantuan or larger, the bonuses increase by an additional 3. At 20th level, if the target is Colossal in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, the bonuses increase by an additional 4. He does not gain the ability to study an opponent as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} at 7th level.
This alters studied target.
8943683f-cd87-4052-8d82-480f6a4443f4: A stygian slayer crawls out of the darkest shadows to strike fear into the hearts of civilized folk. He's a merciless killer who can control a sliver of magic, allowing him to arrive unseen, commit murder, and depart without detection.
e5884a11-0f57-4ceb-925b-1c084c9bddda: A stygian slayer is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, as well as with light armor, but not with medium armor, heavy armor, or any kind of shields (including tower shields).
c0d0b5ed-74ed-4d86-99d3-85537923d847: Also known as a divine assassin, god's blade, or wrath-bringer, a deliverer is a weapon chosen by a god to punish those who have committed an affront to that deity. Evil deities are more likely to use assassins than deliverers, but some good deities use deliverers to deal with problems of a subtler nature than a cleric, inquisitor, paladin, or warpriest can typically handle.
78f4c9c6-43c3-4092-ad90-152ab5fef648:
An arcanist has an innate pool of magical energy that she can draw upon to fuel her arcanist exploits and enhance her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. The arcanist's arcane reservoir can hold a maximum amount of magical energy equal to 3 + the arcanist's level. Each day, when preparing spells, the arcanist's arcane reservoir fills with raw magical energy, gaining a number of points equal to 3 + half her arcanist level. Any points she had from the previous day are lost. She can also regain these points through the consume spells class feature and some arcanist exploits. The arcane reservoir can never hold more points than the maximum amount noted above; points gained in excess of this total are lost.
Points from the arcanist reservoir are used to fuel many of the arcanist's powers. In addition, the arcanist can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} whenever she casts an arcanist spell. If she does, she can choose to increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} by 1 or increase the spell's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 1. She can expend no more than 1 point from her reservoir on a given spell in this way.
d1d3c76e-e136-41e6-a0a5-b9bcfcdf4c1a: An imitator can imitate a martial class style, which allows him to enter fighter, barbarian, rogue, or monk stance for 1 minute a number of times per day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier + half his slayer level.
004710b2-0de1-4cc7-8414-5e0d3c92c601: As a slayer advances, in addition to regular {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} a they can choose unique abilities that make them stronger in battle and define their style of combat.
d2855071-0212-453f-a952-d5e12e192fbd:
As a slayer gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, he learns a number of talents that aid him and confound his foes. Starting at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a slayer gains one slayer talent.
Slayer can take rogue talents as slayer talents, counting his slayer level as rogue level.
After 2nd level, the slayer can select a ranger combat style (such as archery or two-weapon combat) and gains a combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the first feat list of that style. He can choose feats from his selected combat style, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites. After 6th level, he may select this talent again and add the 6th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list. After 10th level, he may select this talent again and add the 10th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list.
dd5b81f2-0884-428d-a627-cc3827e940fb: At 10th level, a stygian slayer can transform into an inky black cloud of mist. This functions as incorporeal form, in which slayer can not {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. The slayer can use this ability for a number of minutes per day equal to his level. These minutes need not be consecutive, but must be used in 1-minute increments.
1e745122-667c-47de-a202-2f26189dd64d: At 10th level, a stygian slayer can transform into an inky black cloud of mist. While in this form, he takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from non-magic weapons. He also takes only half damage from any source of damage other than ghost touch, holy, divine or force. The slayer can use this ability for a number of minutes per day equal to his level. These minutes need not be consecutive, but must be used in 1-minute increments.
380307cb-73ee-426c-9d02-6b24c8fe419a:
At 10th level, an executioner can target studied opponents in attempt to instantly kill them. This ability can only be used out of combat and the target must not see the executioner, apart from that its effects are similar to the coup de grace ability.
At 14th level, whenever an executioner kills an enemy with assassinate, all other enemies in a 30-foot radius become demoralized.
At 19th level, whenever an enemy survives an assassinate attempt by an executioner, it suffers {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} bleed {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
84f61418-27e6-4aea-8f3a-fc51526e5f4b:
At 10th level, if the studied target's {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} is at least two steps away from that of the deliverer, the deliverer's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}; this damage is directly from divine power.
This ability replaces the advanced slayer talent gained at 10th level.
a5b44813-c7f5-4079-a0c0-441a2adcc601: At 13th level, a slayer can once per day increase his movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 30 ft, and his movement doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. At 17th level, he can do this twice per day.
cd22765b-abbe-4315-bdeb-981b963725c5: At 1st level, an executioner's studied target bonuses and the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against his slayer abilities increase by 1 against humanoid opponents, but decrease by 1 against non-humanoid targets.
a16d74c5-ee19-45c2-a01a-c4d50ec4430b: At 20th level, the slayer becomes a master at capturing or killing his studied targets. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a studied target at his full attack bonus. If the attack succeeds, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for this save is 10 + 1/2 the slayer's level + the slayer's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. Whether or not the target succeeds, it cannot be targeted by this ability again (by any slayer) for 24 hours.
ed251836-27c9-4647-81e3-1dfcbfcf53ec:
At 2nd level, a deliverer shrugs off attempts by his moral opposite to control or kill him. On any {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in which deliverer {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} an opponent whose {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} is at least two steps away from his own (such as a lawful good deliverer fighting a chaotic good or lawful evil foe, or a neutral foe with no other alignment components), he gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against that opponent's abilities, as well as the benefit of the Diehard {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} until the end of his next turn.
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 2nd level.
96f83998-2f86-459f-9ccb-67168f6dd94d:
At 2nd level, a vanguard receives a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. Once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the vanguard can grant one of his teamwork feats to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear him. Allies retain the use of this bonus feat for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every 2 levels the vanguard possesses. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of this bonus feat. Whenever the vanguard is able to select a new slayer talent, he can instead choose to gain an additional use per day of this ability.
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 2nd level.
ecd00d80-f2d6-4410-a9b5-420a7174f2f3: At 4th level, a stygian slayer can cast invisibility once per day, using his slayer level as his {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. The slayer uses his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier for {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} when using this ability. The slayer can use this an additional time per day at 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter.
995c224b-6515-4b2f-afc2-16e2d08f5a7f:
At 4th level, a vanguard forms a bond with his fighting companions. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, he can choose one of his current studied targets and grant half his studied target bonus against that target to all allies. This bonus lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the slayer's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (minimum 1).
This ability replaces the slayer talent gained at 4th level.
5206b795-4031-4318-9224-d6a785c4661f: At 4th level, an executioner automatically gains this talent. A creature that takes sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from an executioner must make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half the executioner's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier) or become sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
cf9c8422-0312-43df-b204-7df8330a5e80: At 7th level, a spawn slayer learns techniques to counteract a foe's {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} advantage. When performing a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against a studied target of Large or larger size, the spawn slayer gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} equal to the creature's size modifier to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} (Large +1, Huge +2, Gargantuan +4, and Colossal +8). The spawn slayer adds this same bonus to his {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against combat maneuvers from a Large or larger studied target.
9f99af26-2507-4b44-bd41-d82b3577e1b2: Generations of warriors hold the line against impossible odds. Some of their ancient techniques persist to this day.
5d92b322-57d8-4932-8868-a30570765f91: Increases movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 30 ft and makes the target immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
11f211e0-a625-4391-944c-057480ae62b0: Skilled at tracking down targets, slayers are consummate hunters, living for the chase and the deadly stroke that brings it to a close. Slayers spend most of their time honing their weapon skills, studying the habits and anatomy of foes, and practicing combat maneuvers.
dcb84d30-3838-4ff4-ab54-0ee16ada4847: Slayers can fight both in melee and ranged combat. Their main role is dealing large amounts of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to enemies. However, their defense is rather weak.
a026900f-55fc-455c-b232-b985267b3367: Some slayers study the arcane knowledge to learn new efficient ways of hunting their targets. They are known as arcane enforcers.
f89137a8-552c-4de4-9ef6-d5d2f2ef71db: The human race is renowned for its quick learning curve and love of taking the best from others. Imitators are geniuses with the ability to memorize and copy fighting styles. While others spend their lives perfecting one technique, imitators are already using a few successfully. In combat, they instantly adapt to the flow of battle, choosing the most appropriate martial style and often improvise, confusing their enemies.
0eb45982-be8f-498c-948e-016b47ee0317: The imitator can make sneak attacks, dealing an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage increases by an additional 1d6 for every 3 slayer levels he has. He also gains Evasion at 4th level and Uncanny Dodge at 8th level.
5d861328-ea05-4003-bfad-5d678d1fa7fa: The imitator gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. This bonus increases by additional +1 every 5 slayer levels (up to +5). He also gains armor training at 6th and 14th levels.
f5248823-5acd-4ef8-80e6-21f6aff76208: The imitator gains temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} equal to his level. He also gains Uncanny Dodge at 4th level and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/- at 7th level. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction also increases by 1 for every 3 slayer levels after 7th.
f475afc1-8469-42d9-8f74-b9cfcc475867: The imitator gains the Improved Unarmed Strike {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. At 2nd level, while the imitator is unarmored, he gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} equal to half his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. He also gains Evasion at 4th level. At 8th level, the imitator's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} count as magic and cold iron for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. At 11th level, while the imitator is unarmored, he gains an extra unarmed {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, and an additional extra unarmed attack at 20th level.
1850fad5-ce4d-4613-8a89-988bd551554b: The slayer gains {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. The slayer also gains the trapfinding rogue ability, using his slayer level as his effective rogue level.
a35563d1-c869-4aa9-a8aa-4aad2f437102:
The touched creature becomes invisible.
If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, an invisible creature has a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} ends if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} any creature.[LONGSTART] For purposes of this spell, an attack includes any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Target}spell targeting{/g} a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. Exactly who is a foe depends on the invisible character's {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}perceptions{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.[LONGEND]
1d82600b-43c1-4812-8e84-fe679d533141:
These professional killers are trained and used almost exclusively by crime families.
Streetwise and ruthless, they operate independently, often making their talents available to the highest bidder. Though a few unscrupulous executioners exploit this arrangement and force families to pay higher rates for their services, most of these assassins follow a strict personal code and maintain absolute transparency with their employers.
75a4858b-5f93-46e5-bb15-b2228a91b00f: This active ability gives the slayer {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and chance to hit against a studied enemy.
99262c59-9e06-48b6-afb5-e6d96881ed00: Vanguard gets an additional use per day of the Vanguard Tactician ability.
359a0740-6868-4704-a141-67afdfd6e978: Vanguards are battlefield commanders who focus on the brutality of combat and lead their allies to bloody victory. Quick to react to danger, a vanguard is a valuable scout, capable officer, and skilled tactician.
c4a7d7ef-3aa7-408b-8cd3-d07290dbc8bc: You take no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from non-magic weapons. You also take only half damage from any source of damage other than ghost touch, holy, divine, or force.
